conclusion: The coil is rotating with an angular velocity ω in a uniform magnetic field B.
The induced EMF is given by the equation: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ A ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt).
The coil is square with side length L, so the area A is L².
Substitute the area into the EMF equation: 𝓔 = N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω ⋅ sin(ωt).
The effective or RMS value of an alternating EMF is given by: 𝓔_rms = 𝓔_max/√2.
The maximum value 𝓔_max is N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω.
The RMS value is: 𝓔_rms = (N ⋅ B ⋅ L² ⋅ ω)/√2.
